intro: Androsace himalaica, commonly known as the Himalayan mouse-ear, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Himalayas. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit. The plant features small, succulent leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, and it produces clusters of bell-shaped flowers in shades of white, pink, or purple. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in alpine meadows and rocky slopes. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
